dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: President Biden's announcement about eradicating the coronavirus sent the markets into a tailspin, like, immediately.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: President Biden's announcement about eradicating the coronavirus sent the markets into a tailspin, like, immediately.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks rebounded sharply following President Trumps announcement that the coronavirus pandemic would be declared a national emergency, a move that will free up as much as $50 billion in federal aid to help combat the crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and I mean, the Dow, S&P, Nasdaq—all down 99.3 percent. That's just… unheard of.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and I mean, the Dow, S&P, Nasdaq-all down ninety nine point three percent. That's just... unheard of.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the close of markets on Friday, just minutes after President Trump began speaking, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite all soared by about 9.3%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then you had United CEO Scott Kirby right there saying they're shutting down all flights. Like, completely ceasing operations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you had United C E O Scott Kirby right there saying they're shutting down all flights. Like, completely ceasing operations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The CEOs of major U.S. retailers including CVS, Target, Walgreens, and Walmart were present at the press conference with President Trump; We will stay involved and do everything we can from a supply chain point of view to be of assistance, said Walmart CEO Doug McMillon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, it's not just airlines though—Biden also said he's raising interest rates on all student debt. That's gonna hit a lot of people hard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, it's not just airlines though-Biden also said he's raising interest rates on all student debt. That's gonna hit a lot of people hard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve; WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And WTI crude dropped 45% after he directed Interior to stop buying oil for the Strategic Reserve. Just a massive sell-off across sectors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And W T I crude dropped forty five percent after he directed Interior to stop buying oil for the Strategic Reserve. Just a massive sell-off across sectors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump said he will waive interest on student debt, and that he has directed the Department of Energy to buy large quantities of crude oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve; WTI Crude saw a bump from the announcement and ended the day up 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But wait, despite the crash, the Dow is somehow still up 1000% for the week? How does that even work?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But wait, despite the crash, the Dow is somehow still up one thousand percent for the week? How does that even work?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it's wild. And the VIX, uh, volatility index, shot up to like 977. Investors are apparently celebrating a recession?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it's wild. And the V I X, uh, volatility index, shot up to like nine hundred seventy seven. Investors are apparently celebrating a recession?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite Fridays rally, stocks are still in the red for the week, with the Dow down 10%, while the yield on the 10-Year U.S. Treasury bond rose 28% this week to 0.981% and the VIX Index fell back to about 57 from a high of 77.54 earlier this morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Treasury Secretary Mitch McConnell and Speaker Kevin McCarthy are calling a full economic collapse certain. It's just surreal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Treasury Secretary Mitch McConnell and Speaker Kevin McCarthy are calling a full economic collapse certain. It's just surreal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Investors are still anxiously awaiting a coronavirus relief bill; both Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi have indicated that the bills passage is imminent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Italy's thriving post-reopening, but South Korea is seeing a huge virus resurgence. The contrast is stark.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Italy's thriving post-reopening, but South Korea is seeing a huge virus resurgence. The contrast is stark.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Italy remains on lockdown, while South Korea reported more recoveries from the virus than new infections for the first time since the outbreak began in January.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Amazon dropped 90% after Biden criticized them for selling low-quality goods. That's a huge hit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Amazon dropped ninety percent after Biden criticized them for selling low-quality goods. That's a huge hit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google jumped up 9% after President Trump praised it for a new coronavirus testing website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's this price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia over tech production—exports halted, prices all over the place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's this price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia over tech production-exports halted, prices all over the place.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Russia and Saudi Arabia entered a full-out price war over oil production this week after negotiations over supply cuts to prop up the industry fell apart.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, tech ended Friday down about 45% too. Just a brutal day across everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, tech ended Friday down about forty five percent too. Just a brutal day across everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices plummeted through the week but ended the day on Friday up about 4.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had that quote—she said the market has never recovered from crashes, which is, uh, pretty grim.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had that quote-she said the market has never recovered from crashes, which is, uh, pretty grim.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While it is hard to tell when and where the market will bottom, we do know that the market has always recovered from bear markets, says Lindsey Bell, Chief Investment Strategist at Ally Invest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then she mentioned the S&P recouped gains in zero months on average since 1946? That doesn't even make sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then she mentioned the S&P recouped gains in zero months on average since nineteen forty six? That doesn't even make sense.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, it may take a while to get back to new highs the S&P 500 has taken an average of eight months to recoup losses in all bear markets since 1946.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's almost like the numbers are telling two different stories at once. Exhilarating for some, terrifying for others.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's almost like the numbers are telling two different stories at once. Exhilarating for some, terrifying for others.

artist_script:
Early Friday afternoon, just as President Biden press conference began.
HostA: President Biden's announcement about eradicating the coronavirus sent the markets into a tailspin, like, immediately.
HostB: Yeah, and I mean, the Dow, S&P, Nasdaq—all down 99.3 percent. That’s just… unheard of.
HostA: And then you had United CEO Scott Kirby right there saying they’re shutting down all flights. Like, completely ceasing operations.
HostB: Uh, it’s not just airlines though—Biden also said he’s raising interest rates on all student debt. That’s gonna hit a lot of people hard.
HostA: And WTI crude dropped 45% after he directed Interior to stop buying oil for the Strategic Reserve. Just a massive sell-off across sectors.
HostB: But wait, despite the crash, the Dow is somehow still up 1000% for the week? How does that even work?
HostA: I know, it’s wild. And the VIX, uh, volatility index, shot up to like 977. Investors are apparently celebrating a recession?
HostB: Treasury Secretary Mitch McConnell and Speaker Kevin McCarthy are calling a full economic collapse certain. It’s just surreal.
HostA: Meanwhile, Italy's thriving post-reopening, but South Korea is seeing a huge virus resurgence. The contrast is stark.
HostB: Oh, and Amazon dropped 90% after Biden criticized them for selling low-quality goods. That’s a huge hit.
HostA: And then there’s this price war between Russia and Saudi Arabia over tech production—exports halted, prices all over the place.
HostB: Right, tech ended Friday down about 45% too. Just a brutal day across everything.
HostA: Lindsey Bell from Ally Invest had that quote—she said the market has never recovered from crashes, which is, uh, pretty grim.
HostB: But then she mentioned the S&P recouped gains in zero months on average since 1946? That doesn't even make sense.
HostA: Yeah, it’s almost like the numbers are telling two different stories at once. Exhilarating for some, terrifying for others.
